item.title: Ammobia says it has reinvented a century-old technology
item.description: The startup has a new take on the Haber-Bosch process used o make ammonia. If Ammobia can deliver, it could change industries from power generation to maritime shipping.

item.title: Taïwan émet un mandat d’arrêt contre Pete Lau, le co-fondateur et CEO de OnePlus
item.description: Pete Lau, le visage emblématique de OnePlus, fait désormais l'objet d'un mandat d'arrêt émis par la justice taïwanaise. En cause ? Une affaire de recrutement illégal de plus de 70 ingénieurs.

item.title: Ring founder details the camera company’s ‘intelligent assistant’ era

item.title: Man to plead guilty to hacking US Supreme Court filing system
item.description: A 24-year-old from Tennessee is expected to admit to accessing the Supreme Court’s electronic filing system without authorization dozens of times throughout 2023.

item.title: Taiwan issues arrest warrant for Pete Lau, CEO of OnePlus
item.description: Taiwanese officials have issued an arrest warrant for OnePlus CEO Pete Lau on allegations of illegally employing workers in Taiwan. Two Taiwanese citizens who worked for Lau have also been indicted. The China-based smartphone company has been accused of illegally recruiting more than 70 engineers from Taiwan. Members of the Shilin District Prosecutors Office claim that OnePlus reportedly set up a shell company in Hong Kong with a distinct name, then launched a branch in Taiwan in 2015 without government approval. The branch reportedly worked on research and development for OnePlus mobile phone...

item.title: Meta’s metaverse layoffs apparently include some of its VR studios
item.description: Meta is laying off about 10 percent of its Reality Labs metaverse division, and the cuts include closing down some of its VR gaming studios. Twisted Pixel Games, the developer of Marvel's Deadpool VR, Sanzaru Games, the developer of the Asgard's Wrath franchise, and Armature Studio, which worked on the Resident Evil 4 VR port, […]

item.title: This group of women is leaving the labor force—again
item.description: Women have made gains since many were forced out of the workforce during the pandemic. But that could be changing. During the pandemic, over two million women left the workforce, many of whom were forced to leave their jobs in the absence of reliable childcare. It took years for female workers to recover from those losses, but eventually the share of working women had surpassed pre-pandemic numbers—though their participation in the labor force still remained lower relative to that of male workers. ...

item.title: Affordable Care Act health insurance enrollment drops as costs spike
item.description: This year’s sinking signups mark the first time in the past four years that ACA enrollment has been down from the previous year at this point in the shopping window. Fewer Americans are signing up for Affordable Care Act health insurance plans this year, new federal data shows, as expiring subsidies and other factors push health expenses too high for many to manage....

item.description: Are You Dead Yet soared to the top of app-store charts and became a magnet for investors. In an exclusive interview with WIRED, one of its creators says they’re changing the name anyway.

item.title: EA delays Battlefield 6 Season 2 to February 17
item.description: The second season of Battlefield 6 is being pushed back based on “community feedback.” On Tuesday, EA and Battlefield Studios said Season 2 will now arrive on February 17.Season 2 of Battlefield 6 had previously been scheduled for January 20, so we're looking at a delay of almost a month. As a consolation, the team is extending Season 1 through the start of the next season."During our ongoing development, we've continued to review community feedback and, in order to keep our promise, determined that our best path forward is to extend Season 1 and give ourselves extra time to further polish and...

item.title: Ce détail « nucléaire » explique pourquoi certaines sondes ne meurent jamais
item.description: L’exploration requiert des scientifiques qu’ils repoussent les limites de notre technologie, afin de porter des missions toujours plus ambitieuses. Pour cela, ils utilisent et améliorent depuis près de soixante ans l’énergie nucléaire, l’adaptant aux besoins des agences spatiales.

item.title: Governments around the world are considering bans on Grok’s app over AI sexual image scandal
item.description: After bans in Indonesia and Malaysia, other governments are considering cracking down on Elon Musk’s AI service that is creating non-consenual sexual images. As concerns grow over Grok’s ability to generate sexually explicit content without the subject’s consent, a number of countries are blocking access to Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot. At the center of the controversy is a feature called Grok Imagine, which lets users create AI-generated images and videos. That tool also features a “spicy mode,” which lets users generate adult content....

item.title: Verizon gets FCC permission to end 60-day phone unlocking rule
item.description: Verizon can keep phones locked to its network for longer after the Federal Communications Commission agreed to waive the carrier's 60-day unlocking requirement, as reported by Ars Technica. Following this decision, Verizon must follow a looser set of guidelines set by the CTIA wireless trade group, which says carriers should only unlock a customer's postpaid […]...

item.title: Nissan is one of the first carmakers to offer magnetic phone chargers in the US
item.description: Wireless phone chargers are now common in vehicles, but they're typically missing one very useful feature. Nissan announced last month that it will be the first automaker in the US to offer wireless chargers with a magnetic mount, ensuring charging coils remain aligned for faster charging of mobile devices, even while a vehicle is in […]

item.title: 4 cybersecurity trends for business resilience in 2026
item.description: Embrace and act on these trends early to avoid rising threats. When I looked ahead to 2026, one issue jumped out in every conversation I had with business leaders: Resilience is buckling under pressure. The pace of change is no longer just fast—it is accelerating beyond the reach of traditional playbooks. We are entering an era of complexity risk, where the greatest threats stem not only from malicious actors, but from the sheer entanglement of our own systems....

item.title: Mercedes temporarily scraps its Level 3 ‘eyes-off’ driving feature

item.title: Thousands of n8n instances under threat from top security issue
item.description: Despite being patched weeks ago, Ni8mare is still plaguing almost 60,000 instances, new data claims.
